title: "The Practice of Presence: Understanding the Concept and Exercises"
first_phrase: This text describes the concept of presence as a natural state of expanded consciousness. It is a fundamental practice used by ancient alchemists, Taoist sages, Yogis, and esoteric traditions worldwide. The author credits the Count Jean Pierre de Giudicelli for introducing this practice, which fosters self-reintegration and the realization of the homo totus. To develop the ability to be present, we must first become aware of our presence, and then learn to be fully present in our experiences, shedding our ego-driven thought patterns. The text ends with a description of Exercise 62, which emphasizes sensory awareness and is one of many practices in this tradition.
content: Para desarrollar tales dotes, debemos “querer” convertirnos siempre en más conscientes de nosotros mismos. Debemos dotarnos, de ser “en las cosas”, no vivir la vida en nuestros pensamientos. “Justamente el ego que comienza a considerase a sí mismo, comienza a disminuir una a una, todas las barreras que en principio “ignorándose”, le impedían de animar la perfecta armonía interior, hasta el punto de poderse ver en su plenitud”[210]. Si queremos fascinar debemos aprender a estar fuera de las conceptualizaciones y los pensamientos mentales del hombre medio. Cada uno de los siguientes ejercicios que debemos a aquel que hemos llamado “el anónimo italiano” es testimonio de esta tradición, y tiene la virtud de llevarnos en tales direcciones. Ejercicio 62 Buscar de tomar atención mentalmente a las sensaciones exactas de su mano derecha, después de la izquierda, después del pie derecho, después del pie izquierdo. Lo mismo realice con el codo, las rodillas, las orejas, los diversos dedos, etc.
last_phrase: In conclusion, to develop such skills, we must strive to become more self-aware and present in the moment, focusing on the sensations of our bodies to achieve a perfect internal harmony. The exercises provided by "the anonymous Italian" are practical tools that can help us achieve this goal, starting with Exercise 62, which involves focusing on specific body parts. The key is to concentrate on the exact sensation, leading to a unique feeling that can be recognized and prolonged throughout the day. As with any exercise, start slowly and gradually increase the duration over time.
